Exiting the position is mentally extremely difficult because it means youâ€™re ACCEPTING the loss.

Youâ€™ll start exhibiting risk-seeking behaviour to avoid loss (loss aversion).

Youâ€™re also dealing with potential regret of exiting the position & it turns in your favour.

(5/n)

Since your rational brain is off, youâ€™ll not be able to see other easier & less-risky opportunities in the market.

Instead, youâ€™re fixated on your original position and want to recover the loss from the same position (enter revenge mode).

(4/n)

In all 3 responses, your rational brain (neocortex) is completely shut-off and your limbic system (emotions) takes control. 

The limbic system has only 1 job - to alleviate the pain by generating the above 3 stress responses even if that makes you behave irrationally 

(3/n)

HOW YOU REACT

ğŸ¥Š Fight - start averaging your position or taking bigger position size bets

ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Flight - close the screen and hope that things will work out

ğŸ¥¶ Freeze - stare at the MTM & do nothing while staying fixated on the position

Youâ€™re desperate to see green MTM

(2/n)

ğŸš¨ STRESS RESPONSE IN TRADING

ğŸ When you see your position MTM in red, itâ€™s similar to suddenly seeing a snake.

ğŸ§  Your brain immediately kicks into stress response mode.

Your brain just wants to quickly alleviate the pain generated by looking at the red MTM as below.

(1/n) https://t.co/dm4By7kzJb

â­ï¸ 90-90-90 RULE

ğŸ”¸ 90% of traders lose 90% of their capital within the first 90 days of starting trading.

Trading is extremely hard not because of the complexities of the technical charts and strategies but because it constantly challenges the very core human instincts. https://t.co/BdXBZs9QlF
@kirubaakaran Hi Kiru, can you please shed a bit more light on your perspective of why this can be a ticking time bomb and how could it impact the broader markets?

Criticizing companies and justifying how their management is wrong is the easiest thing to do in the market.

Holding on to good stocks is the single MOST DIFFICULT thing to do in the long run.

That is what builds wealth.

â­ï¸ STOCK MARKET PERCEPTION

ğŸ”¸ Pessimists & critics in the stock markets sound really intelligent with all their perfect sounding logical reasons of why the markets should fall.

ğŸ”¸ But experienced optimists know making money in the markets is more important than being right! https://t.co/XCzwvlN0ZY

Holding on to a losing position is simple & easy.

We all are pre-programmed to hold onto a losing position and so it comes naturally to all of us.

The real mental challenge is holding on to a winning position and sit there doing nothing. 

This is the ONE skill to practice.
@ggmu4231 All good my friend! Nice to connect after long!

Now imagine the mental toughness required to sit there for the rest of the 200 days (10 months) and do nothing. 

And while doing nothing, you have to take in news and views of all sorts about how the stock rally is done and might fall.

This mindset is what separates the greats.

#IRFC gave 400% returns in just 1 yr!

This line sounds so enticing but psychologically it's EXTREMELY difficult to get such returns. Here's why;

Stock moved from â‚¹30 to â‚¹180 in around 250 days. 

But the actual move came in 5 rallies of ~8 days each (total 42 days)

#Reliance stock in June 2009 was â‚¹500 and it was still at â‚¹500 in Jan 2017!

Just because HDFCBank has not given "expected" returns for last 4 years, does not mean it now "HAS" to give returns.

It can stay rangebound for a very long period and test your patience.

Just because #HDFCBank is a Nifty50 stock does not mean that it is bound to give consistent returns.

Look at #Reliance from 2009 to 2017. Despite being part of Nifty50, the stock basically did not give any return for 8 years!

Past performance does not guarantee future results!

In case of Tata Tech IPO, since oversubscription is almost guaranteed, you can apply for the minimum lot (as per your category preference) to make sure you're not locking in capital unnecessarily (by applying 1+ lots) in the hopes of getting higher allotment.

(3/3)

For eg; if you apply under Small HNI category then no matter if you apply for 14 lots (min) or 66 lots (max), you will get only 14 lots in case your application is picked up in the lottery.

Note: Minimum allotment DOES NOT mean guaranteed allotment. It's still lottery!

(2/3)

â­ï¸ TATA TECH IPO ALLOTMENT

It's almost certain that the #TataTech IPO will be oversubscribed in all categories.

In such cases, if you're lucky to get selected in the lottery process, you'll get a minimum lot allotment as per your application category.
